FuncDef:
The binding tunnel gre command binds GRE to an interface.
The undo binding tunnel command restores the default configuration.

By default, GRE is not bound to an interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario

To configure a GRE tunnel interface, run the source command in the interface view to configure the source IP address or source interface for the tunnel interface and run the binding tunnel gre command to bind GRE to the source interface or the interface with the source IP address. GRE tunnels use only the interfaces to which GRE is bound to transmit GRE packets.
A GRE-bound interface cannot be used as the following interfaces:

Data link (direct link) interface connecting LMP neighbors
Interface to be bound to IPsec
Source interface of an IPv4 over IPv6 tunnel


Precautions

If the tunnel interface is numbered in the format of slot ID/card ID/interface ID, after a source interface is configured using the source command in the tunnel interface view, you must run the target-board command on the source interface to map the interface to a GRE service board and run the binding tunnel gre command to bind GRE to the interface. After the configuration is complete, the tunnel sends the packets destined for the source tunnel interface to the corresponding GRE service board for processing.
The binding tunnel gre command is mutually exclusive with the data-link command.
